resources.string: A sexy, secure, open-source, standalone two-factor authentication client for watches.

To import secrets from Bitwarden, make sure you have an unencrypted Bitwarden JSON file placed in the main directory of your watch (/sdcard/).\n\nAfter your accounts are imported, delete the JSON file.
To import secrets from Google Authenticator, export your accounts, take a picture of the QR code using your webcam, make sure it is a JPG/PNG image and place the image in the following directory:
To import secrets from Aegis Authenticator, export an unencrypted Aegis JSON file and place it in the following directory:
To import secrets from andOTP, make sure you have an unencrypted andOTP JSON file placed in the main directory of your watch (/sdcard/).\n\nAfter your accounts are imported, delete the JSON file.
To import secrets from a Wristkey backup, make sure you have a Wristkey backup file placed in the main directory of your watch (/sdcard/).\n\nAfter your accounts are imported, delete the backup file.
You can use ADB or a file transfer app for this.
